Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pellet \Pel"let\, n. [F. pelote, LL. pelota, pilota, fr. L. pila a ball. Cf. {Platoon}.] 1. A little ball; as, a pellet of wax ? paper. [1913 Webster]
2. A bullet; a ball for firearms. [Obs.] --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
As swift as a pellet out of a gun. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
{Pellet molding} (Arch.), a narrow band ornamented with smalt, flat disks. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pellet \Pel"let\, v.?. To form into small balls. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]
pellet n 1: a small sphere 2: a solid missile discharged from a firearm; "the shot buzzed past his ear" [syn: {shot}]
